They know how to be satisfied with their achievements. Basically children do not overconfident or underestimate their abilities. Children with well-developed self-esteem know how to be purely happy with the achievements they have achieved. Satisfaction with these achievements become the energy to challenge new things.

They have confidence and try new things well. They know how to be happy and satisfied with his achievements. A feeling of joy makes them not afraid to take on other challenges. they feel that challenging a new thing itself is not a frightening thing but a joyful thing that gives you another joy.

In general, children with well-developed self-esteem have a stable level of
self-esteem, whereas children with low self-esteem often change their level of
self-esteem. Depending on the situation, self-esteem increases or decreases
rapidly.

and help build a stable self-esteem for your child. Of course, just because you
see something like the one below doesn't mean your child has a big problem.

They are afraid of Failure

afraid of failure. Even if they compete, they think giving up is better than

whereas children with low self-esteem do not challenge at all because they are
afraid of failure. It is because the frustration of failure is so loud and
scary. They hope they have only successful memories in their memory.

The result is more important than the process
When they work, they think that whatever the process is, only the result needs
to be good. Because the most important thing for them is successful result
rather than hard work and experiences.

Shortcut is ok If the result is good
If the result can be good, they think the shortcut in the process is okay. If
you take a child solving a problem book for example, you can see it well.
Children with high self-esteem focus on the ability to solve problems,
regardless of the severity or amount of the problem. If there is a wrong
problem, they look closely at it, and they go over the front to see why they are
wrong. 

However, children with low self-esteem focus on completing the problem book
quickly or on the number of circles. they focus on what they can show others.
Therefore, they increase the number of circles by looking at the answers and
solving them or by correcting the wrong answer when grading.

Play more than necessary to hide the frustration
They hate letting others know of a failed situation and cannot stand the
frustration. They try to pass over their desire to escape with a joke or
something else. They want to divert their attention by playing around.

They are seen putting off what they have to do
When they are afraid that they will fail, they tend to put off work and try to
create a situation where they don't have to.

They push others to hide their inadequacies
They re extremely reluctant to reveal their low self-esteem, failing situation,
or inadequacy. It is because it is scary that others will be frustrated again
when they learn about themselves. That is why they act to push others or
deliberately show exaggeration.

They don't admit reality in adverse circumstances
When a situation is unfavorable to them, they often don't admit the reality and
talk about other situations.

Make excuses in advance
If the result is not good, they make excuses or say less importance for poor
result, such as saying, ‘I didn’t care about this very much, so I purposely
avoided it.’

The result is returned to other people
When the outcome of work is not good, the responsibility is returned to the
environment or to someone else in order for them to avoid being criticized for
their responsibilities.

Other characteristics

오늘은 어떤 이야기를 남겨야 할까? 키보드를 보자니 인생은 Control, Option, Command와 여러 가지 조합으로 이루어 진듯하다.

오랜만에 출근하여 오랫동안 얼굴만 알던 사람과 우연히 사람 관계에 대한 이야기를 하게 되었고 상대의 입장에 따라 사건은 주관적으로 정리가 된다고 다시 한번 느끼게 되었다.

최근 서울과 경기도에 살고 있는 외국인에 대한 코로나 검사가 진행되었다는 것을 인도 동료로부터 회의하면서 듣게 되었다. 갑자기 나는 코로나 검사 결과가 음성인지 물어보는 것이었다. 뭔 소리인가 해서 들어보니 인사과에서 특정일까지 코로나 검사를 받고 결과를 통보하지 않으면 벌금 2천 달러를 내야 한다는 것이었다. 난 외국인 차별이다란 생각으로 뭘로 표현해야 하나 생각하다 "differentiation"이다 말이었지만 그친구는 "racism"이라고 말하였다.

다름(different)과 틀림(incorrect)은 구분해야 한다던 친구가 생각났다. 나는 의미 전달에 문제가 없다면 문법과 단어에 깊게 고민하지 않는다. 이래서 독일어를 배우지 못하는 것 같다. 언젠가는 수학처럼 답이 딱 떨어지는 학문을 배우는 게 좋았지만, 살면서 느끼는 것은 뭔가 딱 떨어지는 것보다 그냥 의미만 통해도 되는 그런 것들이 피곤하지 않고 뭐 그렇다. 언제는 하루에 "출근한다.", "나왔다" 만 말하고 거의 되지도 않는 영어로 의미만 잘 전달하자란 생각으로 일했던 것 같다.

같은 말을 사용하는 사람과도 의미 전달이 안되는 세상인데 되지도 않는 영어로 밥 먹고사는 거 보면 나는 정말 대단한 사람인 것 같다. ㅋㅋㅋ

2021년 3월 14일, '리더의 자존감 공부'를 읽었다.  블로그를 쓰다 보니 오늘이 '화이트 데이'라는 것도 알게 되었다. 이제 어느덧 이벤트에 무덤덤한 나이가 된 것일까? 이어폰으로 너튜부에서 김동률의 '취중진담'이 흘러 나온다.

일요일 오전에는 와이프와 아들이 바이올린과 첼로를 배운다. 2015년인가 시작은 같이 했었는데 나의 게으름으로 인하여 나는 포기하고 둘은 포기하지 않고 교회 다니듯이 일요일 오전에 아직 배우고 있다. 농담 삼아 때가 되면 길거리 연주를 시키며 그 동안 투자한 레슨비를 벌겠다 했는데 실력이 그 정도는 아닌듯 하다.

나는 일요일 아침 이 시간이 좋다. 내가 좋아하는 얼 그레이 향에 취해 이 넓은 카페를 혼자 독차지 하고, 혼자 만의 시간을 즐기는 이 시간이 이 느낌이 좋다.

열정을 잃어 버린 지 벌써 4년이 지났고, 열정을 잃어버리니 개구쟁이 마음도 잃어 버렸다. 안 좋았던 기억은 시간이 지나면 마음에서 잊혀져야 하는데 후회 아닌 미련으로 남아 자꾸 돌아보게 된다.

나의 혼자만의 시간이 끝나려 한다. 어여 독후감을 써야겠다. 다른 사람을 비난 한다는 것! 일종의 자기 방어인가 싶다. 타인을 있는 그대로 받아 들인다는 것은 무관심 아니면 배려일까? 아직까지는 나와 다름을 비난 한다는 것은 자기 방어의 표현이며 타인을 있는 그대로 받아 들인다는 것은 타인에 대한 무관심이 배려보다는 크다고 생각 한다. 이런 마음이 언젠가는 타인을 배려한다고 생각하기를 바라며 오늘 나의 시간을 마치려 한다.

node.html:
Things to remember when your child gets angry
"Please recognize the child as it is, as it is!"

It is one of the good words that you should have heard or read at least once in parental education or child education. There are many people who say how to apply this in a relationship with a child doesn't really touch. That is why many parents say that it is difficult to practice because they don't know how to do it specifically.

Respecting childern as they are

What does "respecting children as they are" mean and how can they be applied in a relationship with them?

The method is simple. You just have to acknowledge your child's feelings.

Recognizing emotions is the first step in a concrete practice way of'acknowledging a child as it is. It is easy for parents to stand in their position now and see and judge their child's emotions. It takes practice and effort to consciously look at the child's emotions from the child's point of view in order to recognize 'Oh, you are now doing something'.

Dad puts honey in warm water for the child and handed the cup of honey to the child because he wanted it to be cool enough to eat. The child opened his mouth a little and yelled that it was hot. Dad once again took honey water and said, "What is hot? It is all cold! Now, nothing really is hot", and he gave the cup of honey again to the child. He looked at it again carefully and screamed "It's hot and I wanted to drink it, but it's too hot to drink. I am angry and annoyed."

You just have to admit your child

Everyone wants to be recognized. The small size of a child does not mean that the amount of emotion the child feels is also small.

"Oh, it's hot? Dad looked like it was cool, but it's still hot for you" "Dad will cool it down quickly~ Hoho, hoohoo~" If you cry while crying?"It takes time to cool down, and crying doesn't cool down quickly~" The child doesn't stop with this healing. It only shows a more grumpy reaction. Even in such a case, let's admit it. "I want to try it quickly, but it's hot so it's hot right away. Isn't it hard to wait until you can't eat and cool more?"

There is another advantage to acknowledging your child's feelings like this.
That is, parents consume less energy. Don't run out of energy by saying,'Is you right, am I right?' This makes it easier for the child to calm down, and the parent can move on to the next step.

What parents want to say must be done after acknowledging the child’s heart first. It is well communicated to the child and is heard by the child. Open your child's ears so they can hear you, and then tell them what you want to say. "It takes time to cool down, what should we wait while our honey water cools down?"  The warm finishes that the honey water was cool enough and ate deliciously while this conversation came and went

Recognizing the child's emotions as they are is the first step in a concrete practice method that acknowledges the child's existence as it is. Recognizing and responding to your child's emotions allows them to perceive their emotions and learn how to respond appropriately when feelings are felt.

Everyone wants to be recognized, and a child's small size doesn't mean that the child's emotions are small.
